title: Was Donald Trump the First President in 56 Years Not to Visit Arlington National Cemetery on Veterans Day?
subtitle: Presidents sometimes express support for U.S. troops on Veterans Day at places other than Arlington National Cemetery.
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: November 2018 marked the first Veterans Day in 56 years upon which the sitting U.S. president did not attend a wreath-laying ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery.
